part.title: The half note and its rest
part.para: In this lesson we are going to learn a new note symbol and its rest: the half note. The following score shows a half note and the half rest:
One half note equals two quarter notes and one half rest equals two quarter rests. So in time 2/4 a half note or rest gets two beats, and, therefore, takes a whole measure:

score.music: (Metrica 2 4)(n * n)(n * n)(Barra Simple)) (c (n * b)(Barra Doble)) (c (s b)(Barra Final))

part.title: Ties
part.para: A tie is a small arch connecting two consecutive notes of the same pitch. For example:

The tie symbol indicates that the two tied notes must be joined, that is, the sound must not be interrupted when passing from one note to the other one. Therefore, when two quarter notes are tied they are equivalent to a half note. Lesson to the following score:

score.music: (Metrica 2 4)(n g4 n l)(n g4 n)(Barra Simple)) (c (n g4 b)(Barra Doble)) (c (n c5 n l)(n c5 n)(Barra Simple)) (c (n c5 b)(Barra Final))
